original: Ekman, Torsten Emil, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. ■8/9/87 i Sthlm av ing. Nils E. o. Amina Wcttergren. G. 17 m. Emy Sofia Carlquist. Barn: Nils f. 18, Ulla 21. — H. a. 1. t. o. m. ring H, CTH (VoV) 09. Res. i Danm., Tyskl. f. istud. av ren:anläggn. f. avloppsvatten 25. Bitr. ing. h. stat. lantbr:ing. 09, anst. v. Gbgs hamnstyr. o. gatukont. 10-13, v. Sthlms hamnstyr. 13-17, h. ,stat. vattenfallsv. 17-22, v. Älvkarleby o. Trollhätte kraftv. lin- rebyggn. 17-20, avd :ing. v. västra stamlinj. Trollhätt.-Västerås 20-22, ar-b :chef v. gatu- o. vägförv. i Gbg fr. 22. Styr:led. i Chalm. ing:fören. 39-44. Skr.: div. upps. i Tekn. tidskr., Komm:tekn. tidskr. o. Nord. hyg. tidskr. Hobby: trädg:’sköts. RVO 45.
translated: Ekman, Torsten Emil, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born on September 8th, 1887 in Stockholm to engineer Nils E. and Amina Wettergren. Married for 17 years to Emy Sofia Carlquist. Children: Nils, born in 1918, and Ulla, born in 1921. Graduated with a degree in Civil Engineering from Chalmers University of Technology (VoV) in 1909. Worked in Denmark and Germany studying purification systems for sewage treatment in 1925. Worked as assistant engineer in state agriculture from 1909, employed by Gothenburg Port Authority and Street Administration from 1910 to 1913, Stockholm Port Authority from 1913 to 1917, State Waterfall Road from 1917 to 1922, and in charge of rebuilding power lines in Älvkarleby and Trollhättan from 1917 to 1920. Worked in the engineering department for the western main line Trollhättan-Västerås from 1920 to 1922 and as the head engineer for the Road and Highway Administration in Gothenburg from 1922. Served on the Board of Directors for Chalmers Engineering Society from 1939 to 1944. Wrote various articles in Technical Journal, Municipal Technical Journal and Nordic Hygiene Journal. Hobbies include gardening. Received Royal Order of Vasa in 1945.

structured.name: Torsten Emil Ekman

worksFor.name: Engineering Department for the Western Main Line Trollhättan-Västerås

structured.description: Torsten Emil Ekman was a Swedish civil engineer born on September 8th, 1887 in Stockholm. He was married to Emy Sofia Carlquist for 17 years and had two children, Nils and Ulla. He graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1909 and worked as an assistant engineer in state agriculture from 1909. He was employed by Gothenburg Port Authority and Street Administration from 1910 to 1913, Stockholm Port Authority from 1913 to 1917, State Waterfall Road from 1917 to 1922, and served as the head engineer for the Road and Highway Administration in Gothenburg from 1922. He also worked on several power line rebuilding projects and served on the Board of Directors for Chalmers Engineering Society from 1939 to 1944. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1945. His hobbies included gardening.
